label: ambitransitive verb
description: Capable of being either [transitive](#transitive) or [intransitive](#intransitive) depending on usage. For instance, [_eat_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/eat#English) and [_read_](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/read#English) optionally take a [direct object](#direct_object): "I eat daily", "She likes to read" (both intransitive), "Read this book", "I do not eat meat" (both transitive). [Ergative verbs](#ergative_verb) (q.v.) are a kind of ambitransitive verb. Compare [ditransitive verb](#ditransitive_verb).
